original: @156b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @156b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: a'arya dz'am gu l'i s'a dha nam /
analyzed: a'arya dz'am gu l'i s'a dha nam /
translated: Āryajāṅgulī sādhana

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: 'phags ma dug sel ma'i sgrub thabs /
analyzed: 'phags ma dug sel ma'i sgrub thabs /
translated: The Means of Attaining Ārya Jāṅgulī

original: 'phags ma dz'am gu l'i la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'phags ma dz'am gu l'i la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to Ārya Jāṅgulī.

original: sngon gsungs cho gas rang nyid kyi //
analyzed: sngon gsungs cho gas rang nyid kyi //
translated: As previously taught, oneself

original: snying gar dkyil 'khor dmar po la //🔽dz'am yig las ni ye shes rdzogs //
analyzed: snying gar dkyil 'khor dmar po la // dz'am yig las ni ye shes rdzogs //
translated: In the heart, on a red maṇḍala,🔽From the syllable jāṃ, the perfect wisdom

original: rig ma dug sel ma zhes bya //
analyzed: rig ma dug sel ma zhes bya //
translated: Is the knowledge consort Jāṅgulī.

original: ser mo sprul gyi gdengs ka bdun //
analyzed: ser mo sprul gyi gdengs ka bdun //
translated: Yellow, with seven hoods of a nāga,

original: 'bar zhing g-yo ba'i nor bus brgyan //
analyzed: 'bar zhing g-yo ba'i nor bus brgyan //
translated: Adorned with a blazing, moving jewel,

original: zhal gsum dang ni spyan gsum ma //
analyzed: zhal gsum dang ni spyan gsum ma //
translated: With three faces and three eyes,

original: gzhon nu ma yi mtshan nyid 'bar //
analyzed: gzhon nu ma yi mtshan nyid 'bar //
translated: Blazing with the characteristics of a young maiden.

original: khro bo dang bcas de bzhin du //
analyzed: khro bo dang bcas de bzhin du //
translated: Likewise, with wrath,

original: sbrul gyi ske rags kyis brgyan ma //
analyzed: sbrul gyi ske rags kyis brgyan ma //
translated: Adorned with a nāga necklace,

original: phyag drug rol pa'i stabs kyis bzhugs //
analyzed: phyag drug rol pa'i stabs kyis bzhugs //
translated: Standing in a dancing posture with six arms,

original: mi bskyod pa ni dbu la bzhugs //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa ni dbu la bzhugs //
translated: Akṣobhya on the head.

original: phyag g-yas na ni rdo rje ste //
analyzed: phyag g-yas na ni rdo rje ste //
translated: In the right hands a vajra,

original: gnyis pa dag na ral gri 'phyar //
analyzed: gnyis pa dag na ral gri 'phyar //
translated: In the second a sword raised,

original: gsum pa gar gyi tshul dang ni //
analyzed: gsum pa gar gyi tshul dang ni //
translated: In the third in a dancing manner,

original: bdud rnams skrag mdzad mda' bsnams so //
analyzed: bdud rnams skrag mdzad mda' bsnams so //
translated: and holds an arrow that terrifies the demons.🔽In the left [hand] is a threatening forefinger and a noose,

original: g-yon na sdigs mdzub zhags pa dang // gnyis pa dug gi me tog bsnams //
analyzed: g-yon na sdigs mdzub zhags pa dang // gnyis pa dug gi me tog bsnams //
translated: and in the second, a poisonous flower.

original: gsum pa'i phyag na gzhu @157a * //
analyzed: gsum pa'i phyag na gzhu @157a * //
translated: The third hand holds a bow,

original: bsnams shing // me tog gis brgyan ske rags te //
analyzed: bsnams shing // me tog gis brgyan ske rags te //
translated: adorned with flowers and a belt,

original: padma'i gdan gnas gser gyi mdog //
analyzed: padma'i gdan gnas gser gyi mdog //
translated: seated on a lotus seat, golden in color,

original: 'od zer dmar po'i dkyil 'khor la //
analyzed: 'od zer dmar po'i dkyil 'khor la //
translated: in the middle of a circle of red light rays,

original: dbang po'i mtshon cha spro zhing sprul //
analyzed: dbang po'i mtshon cha spro zhing sprul //
translated: emanating and reabsorbing the weapons of Indra.

original: 'bar bas yongs bskor 'od kyis g-yogs //
analyzed: 'bar bas yongs bskor 'od kyis g-yogs //
translated: Surrounded by flames, he is enveloped in light.🔽Holding the mudra of the moon vase,

original: sangs rgyas sku tshogs 'phro ba yi //🔽zla bum nyid kyi phyag rgya bsnams //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sku tshogs 'phro ba yi // zla bum nyid kyi phyag rgya bsnams //
translated: he emanates a host of buddha bodies.

original: dug gi rgyal la dbang bskur zhing //
analyzed: dug gi rgyal la dbang bskur zhing //
translated: Consecrated as the king of poisons,

original: dz'am yig gis ni kha brgyan pa //🔽dug gis 'gyel la sku gsum gyi //
analyzed: dz'am yig gis ni kha brgyan pa // dug gis 'gyel la sku gsum gyi //
translated: his mouth is adorned with the syllable jha.🔽Always meditate on the three bodies

original: dug sel ma ni rtag tu bsgom //
analyzed: dug sel ma ni rtag tu bsgom //
translated: of the one who removes poison from those who have fallen from poison.

original: de bzhin 'di ni sgom byed na //
analyzed: de bzhin 'di ni sgom byed na //
translated: Meditating in this way,

original: ring por mi thogs byang chub 'thob //
analyzed: ring por mi thogs byang chub 'thob //
translated: enlightenment will not be delayed.

original: lag pa gnyis sprul gyi gdengs ka'i rnam pa ltar byas nas ;
analyzed: lag pa gnyis sprul gyi gdengs ka'i rnam pa ltar byas nas ;
translated: The two hands are made in the form of a snake hood.

original: spyi bor gdengs ka gdugs lta bu rab tu sbyin pa ni dug sel ma'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: spyi bor gdengs ka gdugs lta bu rab tu sbyin pa ni dug sel ma'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The gesture of the one who removes poison is the bestowal of the parasol-like crest on the head.

original: sngags bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: sngags bzlas par bya'o //
translated: One should recite the mantra.

original: aom na ma:sha ba ra ka m'a ri ye tsutstsha'am tso da ts'i la tsutstsha la ya sam gha dha ni mitta m'a t'am gi aa da bid dhe aa he aom dz'a:sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom na ma:sha ba ra ka m'a ri ye tsutstsha'am tso da ts'i la tsutstsha la ya sam gha dha ni mitta m'a t'am gi aa da bid dhe aa he aom dz'a:sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ namo śabda-marīciye cūṣa cūṣa codaya cīlaka cūlaka saṃghadhvani mitrāmitāṃgī ada vidhe aha he oṃ jaḥ svāhā.

original: 'phags mad gu sel ma'i sgrub thabs rdzogs so /
analyzed: 'phags mad gu sel ma'i sgrub thabs rdzogs so /
translated: The sādhana of Noble Guśelimā is complete.
